definitions.definition: a building used for religious worship, especially in religions other than Christianity

examples.text: the Temple of Diana at Ephesus
to go to temple *(= to a service in a , where Jewish people worship)
They went to pray in the temple.
These deities prevent evil spirits from entering the temple precincts.

definitions.definition: each of the flat parts at the sides of the head, at the same level as the eyes and higher

examples.text: He had black hair, greying at the temples.
There was a throbbing in her temples.

wordOrigin: sense 1 Old English templ, tempel, reinforced in Middle English by Old French temple, both from Latin templum ‘open or consecrated space’.sense 2 Middle English: from Old French, from an alteration of Latin tempora, plural of tempus ‘temple of the head’.
